doc.name: variableNames
doc.summary: Returns a list of all parameters, local variables, and global variables.

examples.example: repeat with x=1 to the number of items of line 4 of the variableNames

description.p: Use the variableNames function to find out which sources of value are available to the current handler, or to see whether a variable name is available for use.
The variableNames function returns a value consisting of four lines:
1. Parameters passed to the current handler (including leading '@' for parameters passed by-reference)
2. Local variables created in the current handler
3. Local variables created in the current script but outside all handlers
Within each line, the variable or parameter names are separated by commas.
